text: Lynn Shelton (August 27, 1959 â€“ May 16, 2020) was an American movie and television director, screenwriter, editor, producer and actress. Her best known movies were Humpday and Your Sister's Sister. She also directed some episodes of GLOW, Mad Men, The Mindy Project and Shameless. Shelton was born in Oberlin, Ohio. She was raised in Seattle, Washington. Shelton came out as bisexual in 2012.Out.com Shelton died of acute myeloid leukemia in Los Angeles on May 16, 2020, aged 54. She was in a relationship with comedian Marc Maron at the time of her death. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from acute myeloid leukemia Category:Disease-related deaths in Los Angeles Category:American television directors Category:American television producers Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American editors Category:LGBT directors Category:LGBT actors Category:LGBT producers Category:LGBT screenwriters Category:Bisexual people Category:Movie directors from Ohio Category:Movie producers from Ohio Category:Screenwriters from Ohio Category:Actors from Ohio Category:Actors from Seattle Category:Writers from Seattle
title: Lynn Shelton
